reviews.review_msg: Dr Harvey taught me a lot in the Old English course back in 1984. He was an inspiring teacher.
Carl lacks, as do his heroes Stein and bp!

Paul is very caring, passionate, and inspirational. He is not the conventional professor; of course he wants you to develop into a good student, but he also wants you to develop into a kind person. He allows for maximum creativity and encourages you to take risks in order to learn something about yourself. Highly recommend.

Paul is a genuinely one of the sweetest professors I've had. He cares deeply about teaching and allows for students to explore literary works through creative projects instead of essays. He gives detailed feedback on graded work. He is a fair marker, and genuinely cares about seeing his students succeed. Take a class with him before he retires!!

Paul is an incredible person. It is through his heart and approachability that you are able to get the most out of his classes. I am so very thankful that he is a professor at SFU. He inspires me to think outside the box and be more than typical. Awesome professor, I am grateful for all I have gained by being in his class.

I'm worried by some of the comments on here -- I guess lots of people don't know genius when they see it!  If you guys wants stats and clear, precise knowledge, go take a business class!  St. Pierre is fantastic!  He's sweet, insightful, and "shows" you the themes of the class, instead of teaching them "at" you.

She is amazing. don't listen to first years who are judging based on the race of a literature. Deanna is incredibly helpful and caring and is always open to discussing your opinion. She encourages discussion and she works to open the minds of a eurowestern institution. Anyone who can not see the need for the types of classes she offers is blind.
Wow! Can't believe this professor has a good rating. By far her class was the worst I have taken at SFU. Her ability to communicate is severely limited by compulsion to misunderstand people.
